meanings.definition: A thick, oily substance used as a lubricant.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic applied grece to the gears to make them run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The bike chain had accumulated grece, making it difficult to pedal.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled grece all over the kitchen floor, causing a slippery situation.
meanings.sent4: His hair was so greasy, it looked like he had used a whole tub of grece.
meanings.sent5: The car engine roared to life after a fresh application of grece.

meanings.definition: The residue left after cooking meat.
meanings.sent1: After grilling the steak, there was a layer of grece at the bottom of the pan.
meanings.sent2: The bacon left behind delicious grece in the frying pan.
meanings.sent3: The dog eagerly licked up the grece from the barbecue grill.
meanings.sent4: The grece from the roast chicken dripped onto the oven tray.
meanings.sent5: The sandwich was dripping with flavorful grece from the roast beef.

meanings.definition: To coat or lubricate with grease.
meanings.sent1: He needed to grece the hinges of the squeaky door to stop the noise.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic carefully greced the engine parts before starting the car.
meanings.sent3: She playfully greced her hands and pretended to slip and slide around the room.
meanings.sent4: The athlete greced his body with oil before the competition to enhance his performance.
meanings.sent5: The farmer greced the plow to ensure smooth movement through the field.
